column13: An ongoing research program is underway to understand better and manage the fatigue risks associated with ultra-long-haul flying, including the secondment of a PhD student from The University of Adelaide dedicated to this program. We are also working with Monash University, which has received government research and fellowship grants, to develop an app providing personalised fatigue management guidance.

column13: Qantas has long recognised the impact of psychosocial hazards on people's health and wellbeing. The Our Minds Matter program, introduced in 2016, aims to understand and improve our people's mental health. In line with evolving regulatory changes to psychosocial risk management across Australia, an additional work program is underway to ensure compliance with new regulatory requirements while implementing leadership practices within the psychosocial risk management space.\t
column20: Psychosocial risk management, mental health, The Our Minds Matter

column13: During FY23, we implemented the Group Musculoskeletal Strategy, targeting body stressing and manual handling. While the Strategy aims to prevent injuries, it also focuses on injury response, early intervention and recovery programs, supporting people who have experienced these injuries.

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column13: A groundbreaking initiative, the Biosymm exoskeleton suits, demonstrates Qantas Airways' commitment to pioneering workplace safety and efficiency advancements. column13: In FY23, we developed a new online course, Acting with Integrity, which will be rolled out to employees early in FY24.
